 WebSockets offer a unique solution for real-time collaboration in web applications.  Unlike traditional HTTP requests, WebSockets allow for continuous, bidirectional communication between client and server.  This means that updates can be sent and received instantly, without the need for repeated requests.  Such functionality is particularly useful in applications like collaborative document editing, where multiple users need to see changes as they happen.  In the realm of online gaming, WebSockets enhance user experience by reducing latency.  Players receive immediate feedback from the server, ensuring smooth gameplay.  This is achieved by maintaining an open connection, allowing data to flow freely without the overhead of establishing new connections.  As a result, actions and responses are synchronized in real-time, providing a seamless interaction.  WebSockets also find application in live sports updates.  Fans can receive instantaneous scores and statistics without refreshing their browsers.  This is made possible by the persistent connection, which continuously pushes new data to the client.
